attributes.action: Allow the British public to vote on abolishing COVID-19 lockdown rules
attributes.additional_details: Many people have expressed their concern on being at an extremely high risk of unemployment and being so restricted, especially with Christmas just a short time away. If the government was to allow members of the British public to vote on ridding the majority of the COVID-19 lockdown rules in favour of a more targeted approach to the elderly and/or the vulnerable whereby social distancing etc. is only strongly advised than law, this will really help the economy and overall health of the people.
attributes.background: In order to improve the economy, prevent further unemployment and reduce the frustration clearly felt amongst the people of Britain, I believe the power to vote should be given to the British people on keeping or abolishing most of the current lockdown rules surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551539
